III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents'
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 gave Youth A vape to smoke. It is unsure if marihuana.
Investigation Interviews:
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 1/13/25 at the facility. Administrator
1 reported an incident report was written for Youth A due to him
having a vape on the alleged date. Youth A had lost his home visit
due to this behavior. Follow up emails and a phone conversation
on 1/31/25 confirms that home passes are contingent on the
behaviors of the youth in the program. Youth A was still able to
talk to his family and is given ongoing opportunities to visit family.
I spoke to Youth A on 1/13/25 at the facility. Youth A reported on
the date of the incident, 12/16/24, he was asked to help take trash
to the administration building with Staff 1. Youth reported he put
his coat on and when he bent down to grab his shoes, a vape
breeze fell out of his inside pocket. Youth A reported Staff 1 asked
him for the vape and proceeded to tell him that he would not
report this to anyone. Youth A gave him the vape and they then
went outside to the administration building. On the way there, both
Staff 1 and Youth A smoked the vape together. Once they went
into the building, they took the trash out and smoked the vape in
the back of the administration building as well. Youth A reported
they saw Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 did not tell him about the vape.
Staff 1 and Youth A then went back to their unit. Youth A reported
Staff 1 left the unit and when he came back, he came into his
room and said, “Sorry [Youth A], I had to tell Supervisor 1 about
the vape. I didn’t want to lose my job.” Youth A reported he told
Staff 1 to get out of his room. Youth A reported he lost his home
visit and was upset. Youth A reported he told Staff 2 what
happened, and Staff 3 let him call his family to tell them he
2

wouldn’t be coming home. Youth A reported he received the vape
pen from a part-time staff a couple days before the incident. Youth
A reported it was nicotine. Youth A would not provide any other
information.
I spoke to Youth B and Youth C separately at the facility on
1/13/25. Both youths reported they have never seen staff give any
youth a vape pen and have never heard of a staff smoking a vape
pen with youth in the unit. Both youths reported all staff in the unit
treat the youth the same.
I spoke to Staff 2 via telephone on 1/16/25. Staff 2 confirmed he
was working on the night of the allegations with Staff 1. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 and Youth A went to take the trash out. Later he
was told by Youth A that he was caught with a vape and Staff 1
took it and gave it to Supervisor 1. He reported Youth A stated
Staff 1 smoked the vape with him. Staff 2 reported he later asked
Staff 1 about the incident and Staff 1 reported there was no truth
in that accusation. Staff 1 admitted to Staff 2 that he told Youth A
he wouldn’t report it, but then realized he had to. Staff 2 reported
he did not know where Youth A received the vape.
I spoke to Supervisor 1 on 1/16/25 via telephone. Supervisor 1
confirmed he was working on the date of the alleged incident.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 came to his office after he had taken
the trash out with Youth A and proceeded to tell him that he found
a vape on Youth A, but did tell Youth A that he would not report it.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 was to go back to the unit and let
Youth A know that he would receive an incident report for the
contraband. Supervisor 1 reported he knew that Staff 1 had
followed through because he received a phone call to receive
permission for Youth A to call his family. Supervisor 1 reported he
did not see Youth A and Staff 1 walking from the unit to the
administration building or to the trash dumpster.
I spoke to Staff 3 on 1/21/25 via telephone. Staff 3 reported she
did not see or hear about what happened until Youth A wanted to
call his family. Staff 3 reported she got permission for Youth A to
call his family and asked Staff 1 what had happened. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 told her that he had found a vape and told Youth
A that if he would give him the vape he would not give him a write
up, but he did anyways. Staff 3 reported a couple days later she
talked to Youth A and Youth A brought up the incident but did not
state that Staff 1 was smoking the vape with him, only that he was
upset that Staff 1 lied to him when he said he wouldn’t write him
up. Staff 3 reported she did not know where Youth A got the vape.
3

I spoke to Staff 1 on 1/21/25 via telephone. Staff 1 reported he
completed trash duty with Youth A. While Youth A was getting his
shoes on, a vape pen fell out of his pocket. Staff 1 asked Youth A
to give him the vape and he refused. Staff 1 then reported he told
Youth A he wouldn’t give him a write up for it if he gave it to him.
Youth A then gave him the vape pen. Staff 1 reported they
completed trash and then afterwards, Staff 1 realized that he had
made a mistake in telling Youth A he couldn’t write him up. Staff 1
went to the administration building and talked to Supervisor 1. He
then provided Youth A with a write up. Staff 1 reported he did not
smoke the vape with Youth A and did not provide Youth A with a
vape. Staff 1 reported he had a “conflict resolution” meeting with
Youth A after the incident to restore their relationship. Staff 1
reported he did apologize for lying to Youth A in that meeting.
Documents:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All clearances and
training were up to date. Staff 1 did not have discipline in
his file.
• I reviewed the incident report dated 12/19/24. The incident
report is in agreement with Staff 1’s interview. The vape is
described as a nicotine breeze.
• I reviewed the staff schedule for the week of 12/19/24; no
part time staff was scheduled to work in the unit with Youth
A.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as during interviews with staff
and youth, only Youth A reported Staff 1 smoked a vape with him.
Staff 1 denied doing so, but admitted he was not truthful with
Youth A about writing an incident report in which, Staff 2, Staff 3
and Supervisor 1 confirmed. Youth A only reported he received
the vape from a parttime staff the week prior with no further
information, but no parttime staff worked.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
